item.title: On 'Fiscal Cliff,' Majority Of Public Sides With Democrats, Pew Poll Says
item.description: Fifty-five percent of those surveyed said President Obama is making a "serious effort" to work with Republicans. Just 32 percent said Republicans are making a serious effort to work with the Democratic president.
item.content:encoded:
Fifty-five percent of those surveyed said President Obama is making a "serious effort" to work with Republicans. Just 32 percent said Republicans are making a serious effort to work with the Democratic president.

item.title: It's ScuttleButton Time!
item.description: This is the last ScuttleButton puzzle for 2012 — and your last chance to win a Political Junkie t-shirt and Official No-Prize button! (until next year, of course)

item.title: Sales Soar In Gaza Of Fragrance Named For Rocket Fired At Israel
item.description: M75 fragrances for men and women get their name from rockets fired from Gaza into Israel in November. Sales have been soaring, shopkeepers say. No, they don't smell like rocket fuel. They're citrus-scented.
item.content:encoded:
M75 fragrances for men and women get their name from rockets fired from Gaza into Israel in November. Sales have been soaring, shopkeepers say. No, they don't smell like rocket fuel. They're citrus-scented.

item.title: One Photo, 126 Frames, 2 Billion Leaves, 247 Feet
item.description: Those numbers represent one giant sequoia. Oh, also: The "President," as it's called, is more than 3,000 years old.
item.content:encoded:
Those numbers represent one giant sequoia. Oh, also: The "President," as it's called, is more than 3,000 years old.

item.title: NCAA Shake-Up: The Future Of College Athletics
item.description: In 2013 and 2014, there will be a number of substantial realignments in the NCAA conferences. Some believe that the realignment process will ultimately result in the creation of four "super conferences." NPR's Mike Pesca talks about how conference shifts could effect the future of college athletics.
item.content:encoded:
In 2013 and 2014, there will be a number of substantial realignments in the NCAA conferences. Some believe that the realignment process will ultimately result in the creation of four "super conferences." NPR's Mike Pesca talks about how conference shifts could effect the future of college athletics.

item.title: 10 Artists You Should Have Known In 2012
item.description: It's hard to keep track of new artists these days. So we asked our colleagues around the country to recommend recent discoveries from their communities. Download 10 songs that helped put these musicians on the map in 2012.
item.content:encoded:
It's hard to keep track of new artists these days. So we asked our colleagues around the country to recommend recent discoveries from their communities. Download 10 songs that helped put these musicians on the map in 2012.

item.title: Options For Intervention In Mali's Growing Crisis
item.description: A military coup brought down Mali's prime minister in March, allowing radical Islamists from Mali and surrounding areas to take hold of an area the size of Texas. As al-Qaida-linked militants take over the northern part of the country, many wonder what the U.S. and other can do to intervene.
item.content:encoded:
A military coup brought down Mali's prime minister in March, allowing radical Islamists from Mali and surrounding areas to take hold of an area the size of Texas. As al-Qaida-linked militants take over the northern part of the country, many wonder what the U.S. and other can do to intervene.

item.title: Drought Continues: Farmers, Shippers Feel Pressure
item.description: The United States is facing its worst drought since the 1950s, according to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. With little to no signs of relief on the horizon, many analysts expect conditions to worsen well into next year.
item.content:encoded:
The United States is facing its worst drought since the 1950s, according to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. With little to no signs of relief on the horizon, many analysts expect conditions to worsen well into next year.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Open Or Closed-Book Exams: Which Style Works Best?
item.description: Afshin Gharib, a psychology professor at Dominican University of California, prefers to give open-book tests. His colleague William Phillips only lets students use cheat sheets. After several arguments about the techniques, they decided to conduct an experiment to find out which method works best.
item.content:encoded:
Afshin Gharib, a psychology professor at Dominican University of California, prefers to give open-book tests. His colleague William Phillips only lets students use cheat sheets. After several arguments about the techniques, they decided to conduct an experiment to find out which method works best.

item.title: No Alarm Sounded When The West Virginia Pipeline Exploded
item.description: The NTSB is investigating why no warning sounded in the control center of pipeline operator, Columbia Gas Transmission, when the explosion occurred.
item.content:encoded:
The NTSB is investigating why no warning sounded in the control center of pipeline operator, Columbia Gas Transmission, when the explosion occurred.

item.title: Caution: Walking Under The Influence Of Mobile Devices
item.description: Nearly a third of pedestrians crossing som of Seattle's most dangerous intersections were were doing something distracting at the same time. People texting were four times more likely to cross the street without looking both ways.
item.content:encoded:
Nearly a third of pedestrians crossing som of Seattle's most dangerous intersections were were doing something distracting at the same time. People texting were four times more likely to cross the street without looking both ways.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: From A Life Of Crime To Designing Jewelry, All In A Nairobi Slum
item.description: Zakale Creations is a jewelry-designing operation that employs 30 young people — former thieves and prostitutes. The Nairobi-based operation is the brainchild of John Mucheru, himself a former mugger.
item.content:encoded:
Zakale Creations is a jewelry-designing operation that employs 30 young people — former thieves and prostitutes. The Nairobi-based operation is the brainchild of John Mucheru, himself a former mugger.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Here's Some Good News: Volunteering Is On The Rise
item.description: A holiday reminder of how generous many Americans are: More than 64 million people volunteered through a formal organization in 2011, a new report shows. That was up from the year before and part of a trend.
item.content:encoded:
A holiday reminder of how generous many Americans are: More than 64 million people volunteered through a formal organization in 2011, a new report shows. That was up from the year before and part of a trend.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Promiscuous Males And Choosy Females? Challenging A Classic Experiment
item.description: We've all heard them: explanations rooted in evolutionary biology for why "promiscuous" males mate with many more partners than "choosy" females. Barbara J. King traces these widespread assumptions to a famous 1948 study on fruitflies — a study that a group of modern-day scientists now say was badly flawed.
item.content:encoded:
We've all heard them: explanations rooted in evolutionary biology for why "promiscuous" males mate with many more partners than "choosy" females. Barbara J. King traces these widespread assumptions to a famous 1948 study on fruitflies — a study that a group of modern-day scientists now say was badly flawed.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: The Steamy Inspiration Of Miguel's Music
item.description: Six-time Grammy nominee Miguel is heating up the airwaves with his newest album, Kaleidoscope Dream. Miguel sat down with host Michel Martin to discuss his musical style and why he wants to challenge stereotypes about R&B. *Advisory: This conversation may not be suitable for all listeners.
item.content:encoded:
Six-time Grammy nominee Miguel is heating up the airwaves with his newest album, Kaleidoscope Dream. Miguel sat down with host Michel Martin to discuss his musical style and why he wants to challenge stereotypes about R&B. *Advisory: This conversation may not be suitable for all listeners.
